text.__SUMMARY__:
Grevillea rhyolitica, also known as Deua grevillea, is a shrub which is endemic to south-eastern New South Wales in Australia. It  grows to between 0.5 and 2  metres in height.The species was segregated from Grevillea victoriae by Bob Makinson in 1997.
There are currently two recognised subspecies:
G. rhyolitica subsp. rhyolitica
G. rhyolitica subsp. semivestitaThe specific epiphet rhyolitica reflects the association of this species with rhyolite outcrops.
